alert.note: Alert for Howell; Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 11:22PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Shannon, northeastern Howell and southeastern Texas Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1121 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mountain View, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Current River State Park, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Mountain View, Willow Springs, Winona, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Montier, Peace Valley, Teresita, Arroll, Alley Spring, White Church, Hartshorn, Clear Springs, Round Spring, West Eminence and Pine Crest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
